titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary guide to the Andrews Memorial Bookplate Collection of Irene D. Andrews Pace (Personal Bookplates)
Andrews Memorial Bookplate Collection of Irene D. Andrews Pace (Personal Bookplates)
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Desirae Sweet and Sonja Foard

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Monday April 29, 2019 at 23:00

did.unittitle: Andrews Memorial Bookplate Collection of Irene D. Andrews Pace (Personal Bookplates)
did.abstract: The collection contains bookplates and other documentation related to the personal ex-libris designs of Irene Dwen Andrews Pace (1892-1962).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Irene D. Andrews Pace, 1963, in memory of Dr. Edmund Andrews (Yale 1913) and his father, Dr. E. Wyllys Andrews.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Andrews Memorial Bookplate Collection of Irene D. Andrews Pace (Personal Bookplates), Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Born Irene Greene Dwen, Mrs. Pace (1892-1962) was an avid bookplate collector from the early 1920s until 1962. In addition to over 150,000 plates in her collection, she also maintained a reference library related to bookplates as well as heraldry and biographical research. Pace commissioned several hundred bookplates for herself. In 1936, she published Owners of Books: The Dissipations of a Collector .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains bookplates and other documentation related to the personal ex-libris designs of Irene Dwen Andrews Pace (1892-1962). Pace was a prolific bookplate collector who acquired nearly 300 personal ex-libris designs. Her personal collection includes designs commissioned directly from artists as well as several commercial designs. Pace also saved trial proofs and final prints along with any correspondence, carved wood blocks or engraved plates, original sketches, or other printed ephemera by the artists.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Bookplates – Mounted. II. Bookplates – Unmounted. III. Process Materials. IV. Correspondence and Ephemera.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged sequentially according to numbers assigned by Pace, which are chronological by date of commission.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains bookplates and supporting materials related to Pace's personal ex-libris designs. These materials were mounted and stored in binders according to the same collecting practices for her other bookplate collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This bookplate is a restrike from a woodblock engraved by Bewick.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This bookplate is hand colored by Raoul Gerard.

scopecontent.p: Also includes three proposed sketches.

scopecontent.p: Blake's work is a design after Suzuki Harunobu.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Blake's work is a design after Vadasz.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With an additional landscape design by Alma and Harry French.

scopecontent.p: Design is based on "an early English label."

scopecontent.p: A fragment of Danse Macabre of St. Innocent's Cemetery. Engraved 1485 by Gyot Marchant.

scopecontent.p: Designed by Canul; engraved by Blake.

scopecontent.p: Artist age 15, son of Herbert Ott.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This design was printed from an original Bewick woodblock.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II is restricted.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged sequentially according to numbers assigned by Pace, which are roughly chronological by date of commission.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged sequentially according to numbers assigned by Pace, which are roughly chronological by date of commission.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Series III is restricted and requires curatorial permission before use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains examples of process materials—namely, blocks or plates—for many of Pace's personal bookplate designs. Whenever possible, Pace collected these materials directly from the artists, often as part of the initial negotiation for the commission.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The two unnumbered linocuts are designed for "A | Bibliotheca Irene Dwen Andrews" and "IDP | Bibliotheca Irene Dwen Pace." The unnumbered block is a design for "IGDA."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One plate is a design for the calling card of Dr. Edmund Andrews. Two additional plates are two different sizes of a portrait of Dr. Edmund Andrews.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Series IV is restricted and requires curatorial permission before use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains correspondence and ephemera unattached to specific bookplates. It includes additional copies of the partial, type-written checklist of Pace's personal designs; four sets of draft correspondence together with bookplates selected by Pace for exchange; and various printed ephemera, including exchange cards explaining the various forms of Pace's name and also requesting that any bookplate correspondence be addressed to Mrs. Edmund Andrews.
